intro: Hieracium adeneilema, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy, glandular leaves that are typically dark green and serrated. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, and its root system is fibrous and shallow. Hieracium adeneilema is often found in grasslands and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
